data.title: Harrisonburg Rockingham Historical Society
data.meta_description: The Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society in Dayton, Rockingham County, Virginia is home to the Heritage Museum, an excellent genealogy library, a gift shop and bookstore, an electric map depiction of General Thomas 'Stonewall' Jackson's 1862 Valley Campaign, temporary and permanent exhibit space with featured exhibits, folk art, and the history of Harrisonburg and Rockingham County. Website designed by HeritageCenter.com
data.text: NotesThis cemetery has been divided into six sections. From the entrances & to the left (south) - Section 1 is closest to Route 11 & Section 2 is directly behind Section 1. Section 3 is the front middle section & Section 4 is directly behind Section 3. Section 5 (children section) is to the right (north) of the entrances & closest to Route 11. Section 6 is directly back from Section 5. Section 1, 2, 3 & 4 stones are recorded from left to right (east to west) & rows are from north to south. Section 5 & 6 stones are recorded from west to east & rows from south to north. Note: There are many graves with headstones & funeral home markers which are recorded in the "Remarks" column. Notes in "Remarks" column provided by J. Robert Swank in 1967.
